question: Which service runs on each Kubernetes node and ensures containers are running in a pod?

How to delete all pods in Kubernetes matching the awk pattern1 or pattern2?

answers.answer_a: kubectl get nodes -n myns --no-headers=true | awk '/pattern1|pattern2/{print $1}' | xargs  kubectl delete -n myns pod
answers.answer_b: kubectl print pods  -n myns --no-headers=true | awk '/pattern1/2|pattern2/{print $1}' | xargs  kubectl delete -n myns pod
answers.answer_c: kubectl print pods  -n myns --no-headers=true | awk '/pattern1/2|pattern2/{print $1}' | xargs  kubectl remove -n myns pod
answers.answer_d: kubectl get pods  -n myns --no-headers=true | awk '/pattern1|pattern2/{print $1}' | xargs  kubectl delete -n myns pod

Which statement is true for Replica set?

answers.answer_a: Replica set is considered as a substitute to the replication controller. The prime function of replica set is to assure the number of pod replicas running.
answers.answer_b: Replica set is considered as the legacy replication controller. The prime function of replica set is to remove the number of pod replicas running.
